title: Strategy Execution Manager Job at Associates Consulting Limited
content:
Associates Consulting Limited - Our client, a world class food and beverage company offering a variety of beverages across the country with its state-of-the-art manufacturing plant in Ogun State, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Strategy Execution Manager
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview


	Our client is currently in need of a Strategy Execution Manager who will be responsible for the formulation and execution of the company’s corporate strategy.


Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Lead the formulation and execution of the company’s corporate strategy, including long-term vision, growth initiatives, and market expansion plans.
	Develop implementation frameworks for approved strategic plans.
	Monitor the execution of strategic initiatives, ensuring alignment with goals.
	Provide regular updates and insights to senior leadership.
	Ensures execution of strategic projects, including the backward integration projects, as well as the new plant expansion.
	Manages S&OP governance, ensuring alignment between demand, production, and supply chain execution.
	Lead the implementation of corporate strategy, ensuring alignment with business goals.
	Standardizes project governance, risk assessment, and milestone tracking.
	Facilitate stakeholder engagement and cross-department collaboration.
	Identify and address challenges or gaps in execution processes.
	Develop detailed project plans, timelines, and KPIs to track execution progress.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Marketing, Operations, Finance, Legal, etc.) to drive strategic initiatives.
	Conduct regular reviews to assess progress, identify roadblocks, and recommend corrective actions.


Requirements


	B.Sc./HND in a relevant field of study.
	Must have relevant years of work experience in a similar role, with at least 3 years in a supervisory role in the FMCG industry.
	Master’s degree will be an added advantage.
	Must have a Relevant Professional certification i.e Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), Project Management Professional (PMP), Six Sigma or Lean Management, Certified Strategy Professional (CSP),


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: associatesconsultantsltd@gmail.com using "Strategy Execution Manager" as the subject of the email.

title: Credit Officer Job at Lendha
content:
Lendha is a quick money lending platform. We provide facility for emergency funds, house / office / shop rent and lifestyle loans.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Credit Officer

Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Job Schedule: Full time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Manage the debt collection processes and work with analysts to develop, recommend, and enact payment plans to eliminate client debt in an agreed timeframe aligned with Lendha’s collections policy.
	Debt Settlements: Accurately maintain client records and manage all past due accounts and determine the appropriate collection action to be taken for each individual client.
	Collect delinquent accounts by contacting customers via telephone, email, and visiting the place of business.
	Compile daily, weekly, and monthly reports on the status of delinquent accounts, collection activity, and accounts receivable status.
	Loan Portfolio Growth: Support the evaluation of loans given to customers by ensuring that credit appraisals are completed properly and uphold monitoring of accounts to identify outstanding debts.
	Report progress of collections to Supervisor, make recommendations for next steps and write-offs.
	Customer Acquisition: Present, promote and sell Lendha’s products using solid negotiations to existing and prospective clients across relevant sectors, including but not limited to companies in the e-commerce, consumer goods, healthcare, and financial services industries.
	Review terms of contract and service with client and clearly communicate various payment options.
	Work cooperatively with other departments to best determine how to balance both the customer's and Lendha's needs.


Qualifications


	Bachelor`s Degree or Higher National Diploma in any discipline from accredited polytechnic or University with NYSC discharge certificate or NYSC Exclusion Letter.
	Good relationship and communication skills with strong team spirit 
	Strong analytical skills 
	Good computer skills 
	Real motivation to work and grow in a performance based environment
	Taste for fieldwork 


Additional Knowledge / Skills Required:


	Practical knowledge of micro / small / medium businesses 
	Knowledge of microfinance bank sector is an advantage
	Good writing skills 
	Knowledge of the major local languages
	Lives in Ikorodu - Lagos axis.


Benefits and Perks


	HMO and other statutory benefits.
	Join a young, passionate, hungry and growing team of entrepreneurs & facilitators
	Flexible working hours.

title: Job Openings at Springfield Agro Limited
content:
Springfield Agro Limited are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Security Guard

Job Location: Isolo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a reliable and vigilant Security Guard to join our team in Lagos.


Requirements
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Experience: 3 – 5 Years in security, preferably in auto or industrial environments
	WAEC holder (OND is an added advantage)
	Good knowledge of security protocols and procedures
	Physically fit and alert
	Ability to respond quickly and effectively to incidents


Responsibilities


	Monitor and safeguard vehicles, equipment, and premises
	Perform routine patrols and surveillance
	Control access to restricted areas
	Record daily security reports and incidents
	Report suspicious activities immediately


What We Offer


	Competitive salary.
	Stable work environment.
	Training and career support.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@kewalramnigeria.com using “Security Guard” as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Internal Audit Executive

Job Location: Sagamu, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time




Key Responsibilities


	Conduct internal audits and risk assessments
	Review financial records and processes for accuracy and compliance
	Prepare audit reports with findings and recommendations
	Support external audits and regulatory reviews
	Ensure proper documentation and internal control systems.


Requirements


	HND / B.Sc Degree in Accounting
	2 - 4 years of relevant experience
	Strong analytical and reporting skills
	Good knowledge of internal controls, compliance, and financial regulations
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and accounting software.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary
	Professional growth opportunities
	Stable and structured work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@kewalramnigeria.com using “Audit Executive” as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Cold Room Engineer

Job Location: Isolo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Install, troubleshoot, and maintain cold room systems and refrigeration units.
	Conduct routine inspections and preventive maintenance.
	Diagnose faults and perform timely repairs to minimize downtime.
	Ensure all systems operate efficiently and in compliance with safety standards.
	Keep accurate maintenance logs and service reports.


Requirements


	OND in Electrical Engineering or Technical certification in refrigeration and air conditioning (e.g., NABTEB, Trade Test, or equivalent).
	2–4 years of proven experience as a Cold Room or Refrigeration Engineer.
	Strong understanding of refrigeration cycle, electrical systems, and control panels.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits.
	Opportunities for training and career growth.
	Supportive work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: careers@kewalramnigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Account / Finance Officer Job at DemyHealth Clinic and Genomic Medicine
content:
DemyHealth is impacting lives in Africa through healthcare innovation and accessibility with our team of highly trained professionals with proven track record as industry leaders within and outside the country. Our core expertise span accross Medical Devices, PCR testing, Diagnostics, Research, Biomedical Engineering, Biorepository and Sequencing services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account / Finance Officer

Job Location: Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	An Accountant manages inventory accuracy, records financial transactions on the software, and prepares reports, ensuring financial integrity and compliance.
	They are responsible for recording accurate inventory transactions, reconciling inventory records, and preparing reports for management.
	Their duties also include analysing inventory trends, identifying discrepancies, and collaborating with other departments to improve inventory management. Assist in Marketing of product and services.


Responsibilities


	Track and manage the company’s inventory.
	This includes maintaining inventory records, conducting physical inventory counts, and reconciling inventory records to physical counts.
	Ensure that inventory levels are accurate. This includes identifying and correcting inventory errors, and recommending inventory levels based on sales forecasts and demand.
	Management Protocols · Record all financial transactions in the accounting system
	Prepare reports on inventory levels, costs, and variances.
	Ensure compliance with accounting standards (GAAP) and company policies.
	Support month-end and year-end closing processes.
	Prepare and maintain accurate financial records, including accounts payable, receivable, and general ledger. Reconcile bank statements and other accounts.
	Prepare and pay staff Salaries
	Prepare and analyse Month end financial reports, including income statements and balance sheets.
	Internal Controls: It is crucial to implement and oversee procedures to safeguard assets and keep the precision of financial information, known as internal controls. Inventory Accountants ensure inventory records are accurate by enhancing systems for reporting, reconciling, and auditing inventory to prevent discrepancies and fraud.
	Develop and maintain inventory control systems.
	Report all risks and exposures identified.
	Identify any additional controls required based on risks and exposures identified.
	Assist in inventory audits.
	Collaborate with other departments on inventory-related issues
	Perform Client Services and Administrative roles.
	Assist in Marketing of product and services


Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or related field
	At least 2 years of experience working in an inventory accounting role Knowledge of:
	Excellent knowledge of accounting principles
	Proficient in Microsoft Office and accounting software
	Operational and field experience
	Medical Field experience is a bonus
	Proficiency in MS Office, particularly MS Excel.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / month

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: demyhealthhq@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
